channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nintendo’s Virtual Boy Is a Silly but Fun Blast From the Past
item.description: This $100 accessory adds a little bit of that Nintendo quirkiness to the otherwise no-nonsense Switch 2.

item.title: Koala Wanda Sofa Bed Review: Compact Comfort
item.description: This sleeper sofa comprises a reversible chaise, sofa, daybed, and queen-size bed—I slept on it for a week to see if it’s good for guests.

item.title: Best Microsoft Surface Laptop (2026): Which Model to Buy or Avoid
item.description: Surface Pro or Surface Laptop? Here's how to decide which Microsoft device is right for you.

item.title: India’s Supreme Court to WhatsApp: ‘You cannot play with the right to privacy’
item.description: India's top court is investigating WhatsApp’s data-sharing model, monopoly power, and user consent.

item.title: A Continuous Glucose Monitor Might Help You Lose Weight (2026)
item.description: Signos is the first FDA-cleared, AI-enabled system that uses CGMs to nudge you towards healthier behaviors.

item.title: Peak XV says internal disagreement led to partner exits as it doubles down on AI
item.description: Peak XV is transitioning board roles and opening a U.S. office while continuing to view India as its largest market.

item.title: TikTok recovers from dip in usage that benefited rival apps following U.S. ownership change
item.description: TikTok usage dropped following ownership change, benefiting rival apps. But now, its numbers are climbing again.

item.title: PayPal hires HP’s Enrique Lores as its new CEO
item.description: PayPal is appointing CFO and COO Jamie Miller as interim CEO until March 1.

item.title: 7 Best Shower Filters (2026), WIRED Tested and Approved
item.description: We tested leading filtered shower heads, from Rorra to Canopy to Jolie. The winners were clear.

item.title: Fitbit founders launch AI platform to help families monitor their health
item.description: Luffu uses AI in the background to gather and organize family information, learn day-to-day patterns, and flag notable changes so families can stay al...
